rules.natural: Either the patient has a fever or the patient has a cough.
In the event that the lab has results available, those results are abnormal.
Should the lab have results available, it is not the case that the results are abnormal.
Either the lab has results available, or if the hospital is not operational, then the patient does not recover.
Given that the hospital's equipment is functional, the hospital's power supply is stable.
If public health notifies the health department, then if it is not the case that the hospital not being operational implies the patient is not isolated, the outbreak's infection is contained.
Either public health notifies the health department or the hospital issues an internal alert.
Provided the hospital issues an internal alert, then if it is not the case that the hospital not being operational implies the patient is not isolated, the outbreak's infection is contained.
Whenever the nurse administers treatment to the patient, the hospital is operational.
If the patient has a cough, then the hospital is operational.
If the pharmacy has medication available, then should the patient have a fever, the nurse administers treatment to the patient.
Either the pharmacy has medication available or the hospital has an alternative treatment available.
In the case that the hospital has an alternative treatment available, if the patient has a fever, then the nurse administers treatment to the patient.
Provided the researcher can access the database, the researcher accesses research data.
If the researcher conducts a manual review, then the lab does not have results available.

Should the ethics committee approve the clinical trial, then if it is not the case that either the researcher can access the database or the researcher conducts a manual review, the medical board updates the treatment guidelines.
Either the ethics committee approves the clinical trial or the regulator grants emergency authorization.

Assuming the regulator grants emergency authorization, then if it is not the case that either the researcher can access the database or the researcher conducts a manual review, the medical board updates the treatment guidelines.
Provided the hospital's backup generator is operational, then if the power supply is stable, the hospital is operational.

In the event that the government implements travel restrictions, the health official orders a quarantine.

Either the doctor makes a diagnosis of pneumonia or if the doctor orders a blood test, then provided the patient has a fever, the patient has fatigue.

Provided the doctor prescribes rest, then the doctor does not make a diagnosis of pneumonia.

Should it not be the case that the hospital's equipment being functional implies the hospital is operational, then the hospital does not activate its emergency protocol.
Provided it is not the case that either the researcher can access the database or the researcher conducts a manual review, then the medical board does not update the treatment guidelines.

Should it not be the case that either the doctor prescribes antibiotics or the doctor prescribes rest, then the doctor does not make a referral to a specialist.
Whenever the hospital is not operational, the patient recovers.
Provided the hospital is not operational, the patient is isolated.
In the event that the hospital is not operational, the government implements travel restrictions.
